result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Katie M. Groelle

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:56 PM Defendant Katie M. Groelle in court.  Attorney Brian David Van Ells in court for Katie M. Groelle.  Attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for State of Wisconsin.  Inducement made.  Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch  for further proceedings.

ARRAIGNMENT
Information to be filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.  Offer deadline is set for August 26, 2022.  
Minutes.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 11:10 am.
Scheduling conference on October 5, 2022 at 11:10 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:37 pm - Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Katie M. Groelle in court.  Attorney Brian David Van Ells in court for Katie M. Groelle. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

$50.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.   
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond. 
--Steven Groelle, 1343 S. 19th Street, Manitowoc, WI  54220
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on bench warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 7-11-2022 at 1:30pm in Br. 1.  Previously furnished recognizance bond is modified to $50 cash with the condition that she have no contact with S.L.G. DOB: 6-24-77 or the residence of 1343 S. 19th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220. Cash bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody. Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued. Copy filed. 
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon. 
Minutes.
Brian Van Ells, through public defender.
DEFENDANT IS TO BE REMANDED TO THE JAIL. DEFENDANT IS TO BE DENIED BY PUBLIC DEFENDER FOR SPECIAL BAIL APPEARANCE. DEFENDANT MUST REPORT IMMEDIATELY TO THE JAIL FOR BOOKING.

2:20 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Katie M. Groelle not in court.  Attorney Carl Knepel appearing for the defendant.  State requests warrant. Court authorizes warrant.  No voluntary appearance is allowed.
Initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on bench warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 6-27-2022 at 1:30pm in Br. 3. $1,200 recognizance bond is continued with all prior conditions, and amended to add the condition that she must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs, except for prescribed medications taken in prescribed doses.
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon. 
Minutes.
Warrant served.

2:24 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Katie M. Groelle not in court.  Attorney Ann Larson appearing. State requests warrant.  Court authorizes warrant.

ADDRESS INFO for Katie M. Groelle
Current: 1912 Rankin Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220   (Effective: 06-07-2022)
Prior: Transient, Manitowoc, WI 54220
Victim Identification Key.
Re:  Felony bail jumping, on 05-27-22.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of disorderly conduct and 2 cts. felony bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-20-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,200.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with S.L.G., DOB: 06-24-77 or the residence 1343 S. 19th Street, Manitowoc, WI  54220 and defendant must provide an address to the Clerk of Court Office, in writing, within 24 hours of release.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 05-31-2022
